data.title: Hallmark Channel's 2023 Movie Lineup: A Complete Guide
data.meta_description: Hallmark Media kicked off 2023 with six new movies and more have rollout out in the months that followed — complete guide
data.text:
Credit: Vassilis Ikoutas/Hallmark Media/

January — Hallmark Channel

‘The Dog Lover’s Guide to Dating’

Premiere Date: Sunday, January 1, 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rebecca Dalton and Corey Sevier

Logline: “Simon (Sevier) believes Chloe (Eliza King) is the girl of his dreams, but can’t seem to win over her beloved pup. He enlists dog trainer Alex (Dalton) and soon finds himself wondering where his real connection might be.”

‘The Wedding Veil Expectations’

Premiere Date: Saturday, January 7, 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lacey Chabert, Kevin McGarry, Autumn Reeser and Alison Sweeney

Logline: In the first movie of this trilogy, Avery (Chabert) has “exciting news to share” with her husband, Peter (McGarry), but their house renovations are making it hard to find the right moment. When BFFs Emma (Reeser) and Tracy (Sweeney) come to return their joint antique wedding veil, they learn that “they haven’t seen the last of its magic.”

‘The Wedding Veil Inspiration’

Premiere Date: Saturday, January 14, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Autumn Reeser, Paolo Bernardini, Alison Sweeney and Lacey Chabert

Logline: In the second film in this trilogy, Emma (Reeser) is busy trying to earn the department chair role while her husband, Paolo (Bernardini), is preparing to open his lace shop. After a colleague makes her question her choices, Emma must turn to Paolo and the veil to get the “courage to stop planning her life and start living it.”

‘The Wedding Veil Journey’

Premiere Date: Saturday, January 21, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Alison Sweeney, Victor Webster, Lacey Chabert and Autumn Reeser

Logline: In the third film in this trilogy, Tracy (Sweeney) and her husband, Nick (Webster), realize their personal successes has given them “little time to see each other.” As a result, the couple agree to finally take their honeymoon. “When a travel delay costs the couple their hotel room, they get the opportunity to stay on a remote island nearby,” the network teased. “Is it possible the veil is once again working its magic and bringing them exactly where they need to be?”

‘Love in Glacier National: A National Park Romance’

Premiere Date: Saturday, January 28, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Ashley Newbrough and Stephen Huszar

Logline: “Sparks fly when Hannah (Newbrough), an expert in avalanche forecasting, brings her new technology to Glacier National Park and faces pushback from the director of Mountain Rescue (Huszar), who relies more on intuition and common sense. Their dual approach brings more than forecasting to the forefront of their hearts.”

Credit: Eric Caro/Hallmark Media

February — Hallmark Channel

‘Sweeter Than Chocolate’

Premiere Date: Saturday, February 4, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Eloise Mumford, Dan Jeannotte and Brenda Strong

Logline: “A TV reporter (Jeannotte) goes to investigate a local bakery which is rumored to have the secret recipe to finding true love on Valentine's Day.” But will the journalist find his own love story with chocolatier Lucy Sweet (Mumford)?

‘A Paris Proposal’

Premiere Date: Saturday, February 11, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Alexa PenaVega and Nicholas Bishop

Logline: Work colleagues Anna (PenaVega) and Sebastian (Bishop) are “mistakenly believed to be a couple” while trying to land client Durand Diamonds during a visit to Paris. “A misunderstanding leads the Durands to believe Anna and Sebastian are married, making them excited about the prospect of having real-life couple in charge of the creative vision for their brand and forcing them to try to keep up appearances.”

‘Valentine, Nebraska’

Premiere Date: Saturday, February 18, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Kathryn Davis and Markian Tarasiuk

Logline: After losing her boyfriend and job in the same week, Olivia (Davis) heads home to Nebraska to regroup. Olivia agrees to get a ride from her roommate’s friend, George (Tarasiuk), who is driving from New York to Los Angeles. “When George's car breaks down mere miles from Olivia's hometown, he has to stay a few more days in Valentine, Nebraska, with Olivia and her sister. After spending so much time together, the two realize that their priorities might have changed, and love is what truly matters.”

‘Made for Each Other’

Premiere Date: Saturday, February 25, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Alexandra Turshen, Matt Cohen, Aaron O'Connell and Illeana Douglas

Logline: “A sculptor (Turshen) uses magic to mold her ideal man (O’Connell) into reality but begins to fall for her real-life friend (Cohen) and embraces the flaws that make love perfectly imperfect.”

Credit: Allister Foster/Hallmark

March — Hallmark Movies

‘The Love Club: Nicole’s Pen Pal’

Premiere Date: Saturday, March 4, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Brittany Bristow and Marcus Rosner

Logline: “Freshly engaged interior designer, Nicole (Bristow), still wonders if the one she is meant to be with is her mystery college pen pal whose letters she has kept all these years. At a loss of what to do, she seeks out assistance from The Love Club — four women who met 10 years prior and made a vow to always be there for one another should any of them encounter relationship challenges at any point in their lives.” Nicole enlists the rest of the Love Club to track down her pen pal — and along the way she encounters “romance, comedic imposters, female bonding, and plenty of mishaps until ultimately, the letters help lead her to her true love.”

‘Game of Love’

Premiere Date: Saturday, March 11, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Kimberley Sustad and Brooks Darnell

Logline: Audrey (Sustad), who is a board game designer, is “tasked with creating a new game to help players find romance” alongside research-driven marketing consultant Matthew (Darnell). Along the way, the pair “discover something they have in common: they each have a lot to learn about love.”

‘Winning Team’

Premiere Date: Saturday, March 18, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Nadia Hatta and Kristoffer Polaha

Logline: Pro soccer player Emily (Hatta) teams up with a small-town coach named Ian (Polaha) to “lead her niece’s team to the playoffs” after she “finds herself no longer in the game.”

‘Picture of Her’

Premiere Date: Saturday, March 25, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rhiannon Fish and Tyler Hynes

Logline: “Beth (Fish) unwittingly becomes the subject of an award-winning magazine’s cover and goes on a quest to uncover the true identity of the mystery photographer (Hynes) who snapped her photo.”

Credit: Hallmark Media/Courtesy of Johnson Production Group

April — Hallmark Channel

‘Love in the Maldives’

Premiere Date: Saturday, April 1, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Jocelyn Hudon and Jake Manley

Logline: Travel columnist Rae Parker (Hudon) is sent to the Maldives by her editor to write an article about it’s romantic appeal and adventurous experiences. “Rae realizes she needs some guidance and support to undertake some of the challenges outside of her comfort zone. The hotel's guest experience expert, Jared Joseph (Manley), steps in and makes it his personal mission to give Rae the adventure she’s looking for.”

‘The Professional Bridesmaid’

Premiere Date: Saturday, April 8, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Hunter King and Chandler Massey

Logline: Maggie Bailey (King) has mastered being a bridesmaid — and has since made a career out of it. Her latest client, Alexis Shepard (Francesca Bianchi), who is the mayor’s daughter, comes with a lot of scrutiny so she is hired to pretend to be a bridesmaid and keep things running smoothly. “Unfortunately, Henry Whittington (Massey), an ambitious local reporter assigned to the society story is sniffing around hoping to get close to the mayor for a scoop on the pending development of local park land. To pull off her assignment, Maggie must coordinate three unhelpful bridesmaids and keep Henry focused on the wedding while hiding her identity, even as she begins to grow closer to him.”

‘The Wedding Cottage’

Premiere Date: Saturday, April 15, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Erin Krakow and Brendan Penny

Logline: “A wedding guide creator (Krakow) must convince an uninspired artist and owner of a special wedding cottage (Penny) to renovate the rundown cottage to host a contest-winning couple for their dream wedding.”

‘A Pinch of Portugal’

Premiere Date: Saturday, April 22, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Heather Hemmens and Luke Mitchell

Logline: “When a celebrity chef walks off his show, prep cook Anna (Hemmens) must step into the spotlight and make the show her own, with the help of her Aussie cameraman (Mitchell) and Portuguese location scout.”

‘Hearts in the Game'

Premiere Date: Saturday, April 29, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Erin Cahill and Marco Grazzini

Logline: Publicist Hazel Miller (Cahill) is thrown for a loop when she’s “tasked with spinning” MLB player Diego Vasquez’s (Grazzini) image. The pitcher “also happens to be the guy who shattered Hazel’s heart in high school.” The project “might be her biggest challenge professionally, and personally, as she takes him back to their hometown in Ohio to deal with what they've both left behind.”

Credit: Hallmark Media/Photographer: Syd Wong

May — Hallmark Channel

‘When Love Springs’

Premiere Date: Saturday, May 6, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rhiannon Fish and James O’Halloran

Logline: “When Rory (Fish) arrives at a quaint B&B on the lake for the vow renewal of her parents, she runs into her ex who broke her heart. Panicked, she pretends the B&B owner (O’Halloran) is her new boyfriend.”

‘Dream Moms’

Premiere Date: Saturday, May 13, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Tamera Mowry-Housley, Chelsea Hobbs, Roger Cross and Andrew J. Hampton

Logline: One-time off-Broadway performer and former backup singer Danielle (Mowry-Housley) crosses paths with a once-aspiring dancer named Claire (Hobbs) after Danielle’s brother RJ (Hampton) makes the introductions. While both women now have children of their own, RJ convinces them to compete in a televised talent contest. “As they start practicing for the show, Danielle and Claire begin to regain their sense of self and passion they once had as performers. When competing priorities arise with their families and cause them to reconsider, the pair ultimately realize they need to show up for themselves and set an example to never give up your dreams.”

‘Love in Zion National: A National Park Romance’

Premiere Date: Saturday, May 20, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Cindy Busby and David Gridley

Logline: “Lauren (Busby) is an assistant curator who is out to prove a set of ancient vases belongs with the Pueblo Nation. She journeys to Zion to find what she needs to make her case and along the way meets Adam (Gridley), a native Puebloan park ranger, who helps her on mission.”

'The Love Club: Sydney’s Journey'

Premiere Date: Saturday, May 27, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lily Gao and Jesse Hutch

Logline: Sydney (Gao) recruits The Love Club — her confidants that vow to help each other during romantic troubles — to run the Valentine 10k after learning her college boyfriend will be there. “After being paired up with a running buddy and also the chef and owner of a struggling local restaurant, it becomes apparent to everyone but Sydney that it is Theo (not her ex) who seems to share a bond with her – especially over their love of food and cooking. As Sydney helps Theo (Hutch) elevate his menu to buzzworthy appeal, Theo helps Sydney reach the finish line.”

‘The Love Club: Lauren’s Dream’

Premiere Date: Monday, May 29, at 6 p.m. ET.

Stars: Chantel Riley, Andrew Bushell and Franco Lo Presti

Logline: Lauren (Riley) enlists The Love Club to get her “get back in the dating game” amid her split from husband Peter (Bushell). “As Lauren comically tries to navigate dating while realizing her dream, it is obvious to The Love Club that Lauren and Peter still have feelings for each other. The ladies set out to remind them why they fell in love in the first place, setting the stage for a heartwarming renewal of the deep connection they share.”

‘The Love Club: Tara’s Tune’

Premiere Date: Monday, May 29, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Camille Stopps and Brett Donahue

Logline: When Tara (Stopps) decides she doesn’t need a partner — and wants to marry herself — The Love Club turns up to support her choice. “When The Love Club notices an undeniable connection between Tara and a jaded musician (Donahue), their job of [wedding] planners turns into matchmakers as they show Tara there is nothing wrong with falling in love — especially with a man who helps Tara finally get the break she needs when they create a hit song together.”

Credit: Bettina Strauss

June — Hallmark Channel

'Wedding Season'

Premiere Date: Saturday, June 3, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Stephanie Bennett and Casey Deidrick

Logline: “Trish (Bennett) is a journalist who is on back-to-back bridesmaid duty for her three best friends. When her date is unable to join, she pairs up with photographer Ryan (Deidrick), the brother of her best friend.”

'Love's Greek to Me'

Premiere Date: Saturday, June 10, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Torrey DeVitto, Giannis Tsimitselis and Marina Sirtis

Logline: “When Ilana (DeVitto) travels to Santorini with her Greek boyfriend Mike (Tsimitselis) for his sister Alex’s (Katerina Konstas) wedding, she’s thrilled to be asked to be her American Maid of Honor. Mike surprises Ilana by proposing, leaving Ilana gets caught in the whirlwind created by his well-meaning and overly enthusiastic mother Athena (Sirtis).”

'The Wedding Contract'

Premiere Date: Saturday, June 17, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Becca Tobin and Jake Epstein

Logline: “Rebecca (Tobin), a teacher, and Adam (Epstein), an ad executive are excited to plan their Jewish wedding, but their wedding and future are put into jeopardy when Adam lands a new ad campaign, and their mothers meet for the first time.”

'Make Me a Match'

Premiere Date: Saturday, June 24, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Roshi Kota and Eva Bourne

Logline: “Vivi (Bourne), an optimistic woman with a substandard romantic history, works at a data-driven matchmaking app. Once she discovers that the success rate for matches at her company is low, she hires Raina (Rekha Sharma), an Indian matchmaker, to provide advice on how to improve their numbers. As they embark on this matchmaking journey, Vivi meets Raina’s spontaneous son, Bhumesh (Kota), and questions whether finding love is something one must take control of or let naturally come to them.”

Credit: 2023 Hallmark Media/Photographer: Allister Foster

August — Hallmark Channel

‘Making Waves’

Premiere Date: Saturday, August 5, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Holland Roden and Corey Cott

Logline: “When a music label executive (Roden) goes to a festival on the Outer Banks to beat out the competition for an elusive new band, she discovers that the group is fronted by her childhood summer sweetheart (Cott).”

‘A Safari Romance’

Premiere Date: Saturday, August 12, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Brittany Bristow and Andrew Walker

Logline: “A wildlife biologist (Bristow) working on fostering the protection of wildlife in Africa is forced to team up with a theme park designer (Walker) who wants to create an over-the-top safari attraction.”

‘Never Too Late to Celebrate’

Premiere Date: Saturday, August 19, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Alexa and Carlos PenaVega

Logline: “Career-focused dentist Camila (Alexa) is reluctant to celebrate her 30th birthday but inspired by Javi (Carlos), a Spanish teacher, the two plan a quinceañera-themed party to honor her Hispanic heritage.”

‘Napa Ever After’

Premiere Date: Saturday, August 26, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Denise Boutté, Colin Lawrence and Tiffany Yvonne Cox

Logline: “After inheriting her estranged grandmother’s winery in Napa Valley, Cassandra (Boutté), a high-powered attorney, takes a sabbatical from her job to renovate the property that was the source of the fractures within her family. With the help of handsome local Alec (Lawrence), she learns more about the grandmother she hardly knew and is able to reconcile the past, while finally opening herself up to a love like she’s never known.”

Credit: Hallmark Media/Allister Foster

September — Hallmark Channel

‘Love in the Great Smokey Mountains: A National Park Romance’

Premiere Date: Saturday, September 2, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Arielle Kebbel and Zach Roerig

Logline: “Former sweethearts reunite at an archeological dig in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. As they work together competing for the same research grant, they discover they might still have feelings for one another.”

‘Fourth Down and Love’

Premiere Date: Saturday, September 9, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Pascale Hutton and Ryan Paevey

Logline: “Sparks are reignited when a single mom (Hutton) and a pro football player (Paevey) coincidentally meet again on her daughter’s flag football field after his career is derailed by an injury.”

‘Notes of Autumn’

Premiere Date: Saturday, September 16, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Ashley Williams, Luke Macfarlane, Marcus Rosner and Peter Porte

Logline: Best friends Ellie (Williams) and Leo (Macfarlane), who live in the city and the outskirts of British Columbia, respectively, decide to swap places after “realizing they both need a change of scenery, only to find themselves completely lost in new surroundings. Ellie gets tangled up in helping Sam (Rosner) — Leo’s neighbor — put together a musical performance for a local fundraiser. Leo strikes up a friendship with Ellie’s good friend Matt (Porte) and opens himself up to writing something different that really inspires him.”

‘Retreat to You’

Premiere Date: Saturday, September 23, 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Emilie Ullerup and Peter Mooney

Logline: “Abby (Ullerup) and Sean (Mooney) used to be best friends. Years later, they meet again at a retreat — and when they get separated from the group while hiking, they must work together to find their way back.”

‘A Very Venice Romance’

Premiere Date: Saturday, September 30, 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Stephanie Leonidas and Raniero Monaco Di Lapio

Logline: Amy (Leonidas) is a New York executive who after failing to “woo” Italian chef Marcello Barone (Di Lapoio) to consult on her client’s meal prep kits, “enrolls in his cooking school in a Venetian palazzo to try to persuade him,” according to the network.

Credit: Ryan Plummer/Crown Media United States/Hallmark

October — Hallmark Channel

‘3 Bed, 2 Bath, 1 Ghost’

Premiere Date: Saturday, October 7, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Julie Gonzalo, Chris McNally and Madeleine Arthur

Logline: “A 1920's ghost refuses to leave estate agent Anna's (Gonzalo) newly listed home. Worse, the spirit is convinced she cannot ‘pass over’ until she gets Anna back together with her ex.”

‘Field Day’

Premiere Date: Saturday, October 14, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rachel Boston, Benjamin Ayres, Shannon Chan-Kent and Carmel Amit

Logline: “Three moms from different social circles are forced to work together to plan their kids' elementary school ‘field day.’”

‘Checkin’ It Twice’

Premiere Date: Friday, October 20, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Kim Matula and Kevin McGarry

Logline: “A journeyman hockey player (McGarry) falls for a real estate agent (Matula) in a career crisis when he’s traded to her hometown and moves into the cottage in her hockey loving family’s backyard.”

‘Where Are You, Christmas?’

Premiere Date: Saturday, October 21, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lyndsy Fonseca, Michael Rady, Jim O'Heir and Julie Warner

Logline: “When Addy (Fonseca) wishes for a year without Christmas, she wakes up in a world of black and white. She must work together with the town mechanic (Rady) to restore Christmas.”

‘Under the Christmas Sky’

Premiere Date: Sunday, October 22, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Jessica Parker Kennedy and Ryan Paevey

Logline: Astrophysicist Kat (Parker Kennedy) volunteers at a local planetarium after an accident grounds her from her dream space trip. “There, she is paired up with by-the-book David (Paevey) to work on an exhibit opening right before Christmas. Will the stars align to bring these two together at the holidays?”

‘Christmas By Design’

Premiere Date: Friday, October 27, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rebecca Dalton and Jonathan Keltz

Logline: “A fashion designer (Keltz) gets accepted into a Christmas challenge to create a new holiday-themed collection and not only finds the inspiration for her next line but decides to redesign her approach to what’s most important in life.”

‘Mystic Christmas’

Premiere Date: Saturday, October 28, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Jessy Schram and Chandler Massey

Logline: “Juniper (Schram) travels to Mystic, Connecticut during the holidays to work at the rehabilitation center and aquarium. She reconnects with Sawyer (Massey), the owner of the pizza shop.”

‘Joyeux Noel’

Premiere Date: Sunday, October 29, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Jaicy Elliot and Brant Daugherty

Logline: “When a romantic painting of a Christmas market captures the imagination of copy editor Lea (Elliot), she is sent to France with pragmatic reporter Mark (Daugherty) to uncover the mystery behind the artist.”

Credit: Steven Ackerman/Hallmark

November — Hallmark Channel

‘Flipping for Christmas’

Premiere Date: Friday, November 3, at 8 p.m.

Stars: Ashley Newbrough and Marcus Rosner

Logline: “Realtor Abigail (Newbrough) agrees to help her sister with the ‘simple flip’ of a recently inherited home. Unfortunately, co-beneficiary Bo (Rosner) has other plans in mind.”

‘Never Been Chris’d’

Premiere Date: Saturday, November 4, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Janel Parrish, Pascal Lamothe-Kipnes and Tyler Hynes

Logline: “Home for the holidays, BFFs Naomi (Parrish) and Liz (Lamothe-Kipnes) reconnect with high school crush Chris Silver (Hynes).”

‘The Santa Summit’

Premiere Date: Sunday, November 5, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Hunter King and Benjamin Hollingsworth

Logline: “Three best friends decide to go to the annual Santa Summit together: Jordin (King), a recently dumped art teacher looking to cut loose; Ava, a shy woman hoping to run into her crush; and Stella, a Christmas cynic with no interest in the Santa Summit whatsoever.”

‘Everything Christmas’

Premiere Date: Friday, November 10, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Katherine Barrell, Cindy Busby, Corey Sevier and Matt Wells

Logline: “Lori Jo’s (Busby) love for Christmas takes her on a road trip to Yuletide Springs with her roommate Tori (Barrell). Along the way, the friends meet Carl (Sevier) and Jason (Wells), but a series of events puts a damper on their plans.”

‘Christmas Island’

Premiere Date: Saturday, November 11, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rachel Skarsten and Andrew Walker

Logline: “When a snowstorm diverts Kate’s (Skarsten) first private flight en route to Switzerland to Christmas Island, she must team up with an air traffic controller (Walker) to secure her dream job as the family’s pilot.”

‘A Heidelberg Holiday’

Premiere Date: Sunday, November 12, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Ginna Claire Mason and Frédéric Brossier

Logline: “Heidi Heidelberg (Mason) receives the dream opportunity to sell her beautiful, handmade glass ornaments at the prestigious Heidelberg Christmas Market in Germany. While there, she meets Lukas (Brossier), a local artisan who helps her reconnect with her lost heritage.”

‘Navigating Christmas’

Premiere Date: Friday, November 17, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Chelsea Hobbs and Stephen Huszar

Logline: “Recently divorced Melanie (Hobbs) and her son Jason visit a remote island for Christmas, only to find themselves running a real working lighthouse where she connects with the curt but cute owner (Huszar).”

‘A Merry Scottish Christmas’

Premiere Date: Saturday, November 18, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lacey Chabert and Scott Wolf

Logline: “When estranged siblings Lindsay (Chabert) and Brad (Wolf) Morgan travel to Scotland at Christmas to reunite with their mother Jo, a big family secret is revealed.”

‘Holiday Hotline’

Premiere Date: Sunday, November 19, at 9 p.m. ET.

Stars: Emily Tennant and Niall Matter

Logline: “After leaving London, Abby (Tennant) connects with an anonymous caller while working at a cooking hotline. The caller is single dad John (Matter) who Abby unknowingly has become smitten with in real life.”

‘Catch Me If You Claus’

Premiere Date: Thursday, November 23, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Italia Ricci and Luke Macfarlane

Logline: “Avery Quinn (Ricci) is an aspiring news anchor who’s finally getting her big break on her station’s Christmas morning newscast. But that’s put in jeopardy when she captures an intruder in her home wearing a red suit claiming to be Chris (Macfarlane), Santa’s son, who is on his first mission.”

‘Letters to Santa’

Premiere Date: Friday, November 24, at 6 p.m. ET.

Stars: Katie Leclerc and Rafael de la Fuente

Logline: “When young siblings receive a magic pen from Santa that appears to be granting wishes, they request a Christmas gift they want more than anything — for their separated parents (Leclerc, de la Fuente) to reunite.”

‘Holiday Road’

Premiere Date: Friday, November 24, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Sara Canning and Warren Christie

Logline: “When bad weather leaves each of them stranded at the airport for the holidays, a tech entrepreneur (Christie), a travel writer (Canning), a devoted mother (Enid-Raye Adams) and her son (Kiefer O’Reilly), a stubborn senior (Trevor Lerner), an enigmatic woman with a hint of mystery (Brittany Willacy), a couple traveling from Hong Kong (Sharon Crandall, Ryan Mah) and a social media influencer (Princess Davis) all agree to rent a shared van to embark on a road trip to Denver.” (Inspired by true events.)

‘Christmas in Notting Hill’

Premiere Date: Saturday, November 25, at 6 p.m. ET.

Stars: Sarah Ramos and William Moseley

Logline: “Famous soccer star Graham Savoy (Moseley) has always been too busy for love, but when he comes home to Notting Hill for Christmas, he changes his mind after meeting Georgia (Ramos) — a visiting American and the one person who has no idea who he is.”

‘Haul Out the Holly: Lit Up’

Premiere Date: Saturday, November 25, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lacey Chabert, Wes Brown, Stephen Tobolowsky, Melissa Peterman, Ellen Travolta, Seth Morris and Jennifer Aspen

Logline: A sequel to 2022’s Haul Out the Holly, “Emily (Chabert) and Jared (Brown) are looking forward to celebrating the holidays together again, this time as a couple.”

‘Our Christmas Mural’

Premiere Date: Sunday, November 26, at 6 p.m. ET.

Stars: Alex Paxton-Beesley and Dan Jeannotte

Logline: “Olivia (Paxton-Beesley) is a single mom who returns home for Christmas. Her mom secretly enters her into a mural contest.”

‘A Biltmore Christmas’

Premiere Date: Sunday, November 26, 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Bethany Joy Lenz, Kristoffer Polaha, Jonathan Frakes and Robert Picardo

Logline: “Lucy Hardgrove (Lenz) is a screenwriter who lands the job of a lifetime when she’s hired to pen the script for a remake of the beloved, holiday movie classic, His Merry Wife! When the head of the studio isn’t satisfied with the ending Lucy wrote, he sends her to the Biltmore Estate for research and inspiration.”

Credit: Kailey Schwerman/Hallmark Media

November — Hallmark Movies & Mysteries

‘My Christmas Guide’

Premiere Date: Thursday, November 2, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Amber Marshall and Ben Mehl

Logline: “After losing his eyesight, a college professor (Mehl) adopts a seeing eye dog from a guide dog trainer (Marshall). As they all begin to spend time together, his confidence returns and his heart begins to open.”

‘Mystery on Mistletoe Lane’

Premiere Date: Thursday, November 9, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Victor Webster and Erica Cerra

Logline: “New to town, Heidi Wicks (Cerra) and her kids discover a Christmas mystery in their historic home. Local handyman and historian David (Webster) helps along the way, finding his own surprising connection.”

‘A World Record Christmas’

Premiere Date: Thursday, November 16, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Nikki DeLoach, Lucas Bryant and Aias Dalman

Logline: “Charlie (Dalman) is an autistic boy determined to set a Guinness World Record by stacking 1400 Jenga blocks. His mother Marissa (DeLoach) and stepfather Eric (Bryant) encourage him to reach for his dream and they all celebrate when he gets the good news that he’ll have get his chance on Christmas Eve. In the spirit of the holiday, they organize a fundraiser giving the townspeople an opportunity to donate and decorate a Jenga block, with the proceeds going to benefit kids with autism.”

‘A Season for Family’

Premiere Date: Wednesday, November 22, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Stacey Farber and Brendan Penny

Logline: “Siblings adopted into separate families wish to reunite for Christmas.”

‘Time for Her to Come Home for Christmas’

Premiere Date: Thursday, November 30, at 6 p.m. ET.

Stars: Shenae Grimes-Beech, Chris Carmack and Grace Leer

Logline: “Facing her first Christmas without her mother and looking to avoid loneliness, Carly (Grimes-Beech) heads to a quaint town to lead the church choir at Christmas. Once there, Carly meets Matthew (Carmack), a man back in town after serving in the army. As she gets to know Matthew, the choir and townspeople, she stumbles across clues that suggest she may have been brought here for a life changing reason. As the mystery unravels one thing is clear, this journey will teach Carly about true love, learning to trust, and that forgiveness is needed to finally heal.”

Credit: Allister Foster/Hallmark Media

December — Hallmark Channel

‘My Norwegian Holiday’

Premiere Date: Friday, December 1, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Rhiannon Fish and David Elsendoorn

Logline: “JJ (Fish), grieving the loss of her grandmother and seeking dissertation inspiration, stumbles upon an unexpected holiday destiny. Meeting Henrik (Elsendoorn), a Norwegian from Bergen, their connection deepens when he discovers she has a troll figurine from his hometown.”

‘A Not So Royal Christmas’

Premiere Date: Saturday, December 2, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Brooke D’Orsay and Will Kemp

Logline: “Tabloid journalist Charlotte (D’Orsay) attempts to land an interview with a reclusive Count. In response, the royal family has a groundskeeper (Kemp) pose as the Count since the real one fled years ago.”

‘Christmas With a Kiss’

Premiere Date: Sunday, December 3, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Mishael Morgan, Ronnie Rowe Jr. and Jaime M. Callica

Logline: “A woman (Morgan) returns home to help with her family’s Christmas Carnival and romance ignites.”

‘Magic in Mistletoe’

Premiere Date: Friday, December 8, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Lyndie Greenwood and Paul Campbell

Logline: “Harrington (Campbell) is the author of a popular book series, but commercial success has left him a bitter recluse. As he returns to his hometown for an annual Christmas festival celebrating his books, he’s joined by April (Greenwood), a publicist for the major publishing house he works with.”

‘Christmas on Cherry Lane’

Premiere Date: Saturday, December 9, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Catherine Bell, Jonathan Bennett, John Brotherton, Erin Cahill, James Denton and Vincent Rodriguez III

Logline: “A young couple preparing to welcome their first child (Brotherton, Cahill); an empty-nester (Bell) and her fiancé (Denton) ready to start a new chapter; and a couple (Bennett, Rodriguez III) who unexpectedly have the chance to expand their family on Christmas Eve celebrate the holiday as they navigate these turning points in their lives.”

‘Round and Round’

Premiere Date: Sunday, December 10, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Vic Michaelis, Bryan Greenberg and Rick Hoffman

Logline: “Rachel’s (Michaelis) stuck in a time loop, reliving the night of her parents’ Hanukkah party. Can Zach (Greenberg), the “nice boy” Grandma’s trying to set her up with, help her make it to tomorrow?”

‘The Secret Gift of Christmas’

Premiere Date: Friday, December 15, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Meghan Ory and Christopher Russell

Logline: “Bonnie (Ory) is a personal shopper who helps her new, widowed client Patrick (Russell) reconnect with his young daughter. She is determined to get Patrick and his daughter everything on their wish list.”

‘Sealed With a List’

Premiere Date: Saturday, December 16, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Katie Findlay and Evan Roderick

Logline: “This holiday season, festive Carley (Findlay) sets out to conquer her list of abandoned resolutions from last year. Aided by coworker Wyatt (Roderick), she finds love and the confidence to chase her dreams.”

‘Friends & Family Christmas’

Premiere Date: Sunday, December 17, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Humberly Gonzalez and Ali Liebert

Logline: “Daniella (Gonzalez) has recently moved to New York to pursue an art career. Amelia (Liebert) is a talented entertainment lawyer trying to stay focused on her work after a broken engagement. When Daniella and Amelia are set up by their parents, they agree to pretend that they are dating, to appease them for the holidays.”

Credit: Steven Ackerman/Hallmark Media

December — Hallmark Movies & Mysteries

‘To All a Good Night’

Premiere Date: Thursday, December 7, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Kimberley Sustad and Mark Ghanimé

Logline: “A small-town photographer (Sustad) saves the life of a mysterious man (Ghanimé), who may just be in town to buy her family’s parkland — which is also the location of the annual Christmas celebration.”

‘Heaven Down Here’

Premiere Date: Thursday, December 14, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Krystal Joy Brown, Tina Lifford, Juan Riedinger, Richard Harmon and Phylicia Rashad

Logline: “Inspired by Mickey Guyton’s song of the same name, ‘Heaven Down Here,’ tells the story of four disparate people who find themselves stranded in a local diner on Christmas Eve when a snowstorm hits the town.”

‘Miracle in Bethlehem, PA’

Premiere Date: Thursday, December 21, at 8 p.m. ET.

Stars: Laura Vandervoort and Benjamin Ayres

Logline: “Successful and fiercely independent, Mary Ann Brubeck (Vandervoort) adopts a baby girl to raise on her own just before Christmas. Due to weather, she and the baby get stuck in Bethlehem, PA for the holidays. When there is no room at the inn, her only option is to stay with the innkeeper’s brother Joe (Ayres).”
